January 28, 2022
muel0017
[QUOTE=Goop;12170310]Hes a bit overcosted for triple target incap, short range with outwit. For 75points you need to be doing more than that. He is however AMAZING for his cheaper point line. At this line he's just kinda ok.[/QUOTE] He's actually really good at both starting lines. Running shot for 3 with outwit isnt anything to sleep on. I played him the other day and he Running shot into hindering for Stealth. Then triple incapped 3 people to get them all to 2 tokens. Is he going to KO their entire force, no. Is he going to help you maneuver your other people into good offensive positions by being bait and a distraction that can also be a danger to their force, yes.
December 16, 2021
Hayes Blackman
I actually really love the incap at the end. Triple target flurry incap with prob?! Talk about shutting down a heard. Iâ€™ve never loved an uncommon this much.
December 15, 2021
Buckwheat
In terms of playability, my only complaint is the Incapacitate, at the end of the dial. I would have preferred Precision Strike. Upfront, he's devastating. Having Stealth while being able to ignore Stealth is strong. Having that with high speed Running Shot, three targets, and Outwit, is brutal. I agree that the dial is lacking flavor, and I think that the helpings of Outwit and PC are excessive; however, this is the best Daredevil that WK has made, since the 2014 Deadpool set, IMO.
December 12, 2021
SpaceTitanium
Is this the best daredevil we've had? Sure. It's got powers in every slot and good numbers. Is it an interesting daredevil? Not really. Even his trait is just another standard power, just kind of feels flavourless for a character with such depth and history.
December 10, 2021
Slade Wilson
A must own figure for fans of DD.
December 7, 2021
Goop
Hes a bit overcosted for triple target incap, short range with outwit. For 75points you need to be doing more than that. He is however AMAZING for his cheaper point line. At this line he's just kinda ok.
